intro: Marsdenia magniflora, commonly known as the giant milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including mammals and insects. Marsdenia magniflora is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
